transportAdvice: Accra has a network of shared minibuses and trotros that cover most areas of the city, though they can be crowded and routes are not always clearly marked for first-time visitors; taxis are widely available and a practical option for tourists, while walking is feasible in specific neighborhoods but less practical across the sprawling city due to heat, traffic, and limited pavements.

weather.description: Hot and dry with harmattan haze reducing visibility; generally sunny and comfortable for sightseeing.
Warm and mostly dry with occasional brief showers; one of the better months for outdoor activities.
Heat and humidity begin to build as the rainy season approaches; expect some afternoon showers.
Increasing rainfall with warm temperatures; short but heavy downpours are common in the afternoons.
One of the wettest months with frequent heavy rain; flooding can affect roads and travel plans.
Peak of the main rainy season with overcast skies and regular downpours; temperatures cool slightly.
A brief drier interlude between the two rainy seasons; cooler and less humid than surrounding months.
Relatively dry and cooler with overcast conditions; a pleasant time to visit despite occasional showers.
The minor rainy season begins with increasing showers and rising humidity.
One of the wetter months of the minor rainy season; expect frequent afternoon and evening rain.
Rainfall decreases significantly as the dry season returns; warm and increasingly sunny conditions.
Dry and warm with harmattan winds beginning to arrive; good conditions for travel and outdoor exploration.
